notes: Both ask about the Fed Funds rate level at/after FOMC meetings. ForecastEx uses target rate brackets; Kalshi uses rate threshold contracts. Same underlying data source (FOMC announcement). Different contract structures require bracket-to-threshold alignment.

ForecastEx FFDEC is specifically about the decision action (hold vs cut vs hike by 25/50bps). Kalshi KXFED asks about the resulting rate level. Same event but different framing — need to derive decision from rate level changes.
ForecastEx FF series across multiple meetings can be combined to infer cumulative cuts. Kalshi KXRATECUTCOUNT is a single year-end count contract. Indirect mapping — requires aggregation logic.
